content.text: Now let me write the Python script.

input.content:
#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Calculate how many H2O molecules are needed to span one light year
when stacked end-to-end.
"""

# Constants
WATER_DIAMETER_ANGSTROMS = 2.75  # angstroms
LIGHT_YEAR_METERS = 9.461e15  # meters
ANGSTROMS_TO_METERS = 1e-10
AVOGADRO_NUMBER = 6.02214076e23  # molecules/mol
MOLAR_MASS_H2O = 18.015  # g/mol
WATER_DENSITY = 1.0  # g/mL (approximately)

def main():
    # Convert water diameter to meters
    water_diameter_m = WATER_DIAMETER_ANGSTROMS * ANGSTROMS_TO_METERS

    # Calculate number of molecules needed
    num_molecules = LIGHT_YEAR_METERS / water_diameter_m

    # Calculate moles
    num_moles = num_molecules / AVOGADRO_NUMBER

    # Calculate grams
    mass_grams = num_moles * MOLAR_MASS_H2O

    # Calculate liters (assuming water density of 1 g/mL)
    volume_liters = mass_grams / WATER_DENSITY / 1000

    # Display results
    print("=" * 70)
    print("H2O MOLECULES TO SPAN ONE LIGHT YEAR")
    print("=" * 70)
    print(f"Water molecule diameter: {WATER_DIAMETER_ANGSTROMS} angstroms")
    print(f"Light year distance: {LIGHT_YEAR_METERS:.3e} meters")
    print()
    print(f"Number of molecules: {num_molecules:.6e}")
    print(f"Number of moles: {num_moles:.6e} mol")
    print(f"Mass: {mass_grams:.6e} grams")
    print(f"Volume: {volume_liters:.6e} liters")
    print("=" * 70)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

tool_use_result.content:
#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Calculate how many H2O molecules are needed to span one light year
when stacked end-to-end.
"""

# Constants
WATER_DIAMETER_ANGSTROMS = 2.75  # angstroms
LIGHT_YEAR_METERS = 9.461e15  # meters
ANGSTROMS_TO_METERS = 1e-10
AVOGADRO_NUMBER = 6.02214076e23  # molecules/mol
MOLAR_MASS_H2O = 18.015  # g/mol
WATER_DENSITY = 1.0  # g/mL (approximately)

def main():
    # Convert water diameter to meters
    water_diameter_m = WATER_DIAMETER_ANGSTROMS * ANGSTROMS_TO_METERS

    # Calculate number of molecules needed
    num_molecules = LIGHT_YEAR_METERS / water_diameter_m

    # Calculate moles
    num_moles = num_molecules / AVOGADRO_NUMBER

    # Calculate grams
    mass_grams = num_moles * MOLAR_MASS_H2O

    # Calculate liters (assuming water density of 1 g/mL)
    volume_liters = mass_grams / WATER_DENSITY / 1000

    # Display results
    print("=" * 70)
    print("H2O MOLECULES TO SPAN ONE LIGHT YEAR")
    print("=" * 70)
    print(f"Water molecule diameter: {WATER_DIAMETER_ANGSTROMS} angstroms")
    print(f"Light year distance: {LIGHT_YEAR_METERS:.3e} meters")
    print()
    print(f"Number of molecules: {num_molecules:.6e}")
    print(f"Number of moles: {num_moles:.6e} mol")
    print(f"Mass: {mass_grams:.6e} grams")
    print(f"Volume: {volume_liters:.6e} liters")
    print("=" * 70)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
